tool_description: Generates antenna radiation patterns including gain, beamwidth, and directional characteristics for various antenna types used in RF coverage modeling.

antenna_type.description: Type of antenna: omnidirectional, sector, yagi, parabolic, horn, patch

azimuth_degrees.description: Azimuth pointing direction in degrees (0 to 359)

error_messages: Invalid antenna type: Must be one of [omnidirectional, sector, yagi, parabolic, horn, patch].
Invalid frequency: Frequency must be between 30 and 30000 MHz.
Invalid gain: Gain must be between -10 and 50 dBi.
Invalid beamwidth: Beamwidth must be between 10 and 360 degrees.
Invalid tilt: Tilt must be between -30 and 30 degrees.
Invalid azimuth: Azimuth must be between 0 and 359 degrees.
usage: Select antenna type and specify operating frequency and gain. For directional antennas, set beamwidth, tilt, and azimuth. The tool generates 3D radiation patterns for propagation modeling.

horizontal_pattern.description: Horizontal plane gain values in dB at 1-degree intervals

vertical_pattern.description: Vertical plane gain values in dB at 1-degree intervals

max_gain_direction.description: Azimuth and elevation angles of maximum gain
